result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Paul Vesper Jr

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Robert Paul Vesper Jr
Current: UNKNOWN,   (Effective: 09-12-2022)
Prior: 2712 University Ct, Waukesha, WI 53188

addressed to: Robert Vesper Jr. for hearing on November 9, 2022
Return to Sender, Attempted Not Known, Unable to Forward.

8:32 AM Defendant Robert Paul Vesper Jr in court.  Attorney Thomas C Simon Aty in court for Robert Paul Vesper Jr. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
This is the first appearance in Branch 2.
Defense has received discovery and an offer. 
Defense is anticipating a resolution, and requests time to get into treatment. 
Defense will notify the court if requesting a plea and sentencing.
Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:16 AM Defendant Robert Paul Vesper in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:21 AM Defendant Robert Paul Vesper in court with attorney Thomas C Simon by zoom video.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Repayment at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing August 1, 2022. (BC)

LF 5/26--mailed copy of Order to defendant; sent to BC.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
09:59 AM Defendant Robert Paul Vesper in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing August 1, 2022.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO GO TO THE BUSINESS CENTER AFTER COURT TO SET UP A PAYMENT PLAN.  Hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:16 AM Defendant Robert Paul Vesper in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
The Defendant states he is seeking an attorney.
The Court notes that the Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation in 22CM721.
The Court orders the Defendant to call SPD.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.

02:25 PM Defendant Robert Paul Vesper in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Justin Griffies appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
